title: Using Walnut Husks to Stun Fish
brief: Crush green husks from butternuts or black walnuts to create a natural fish poison.
steps: Step 1: Locate butternut or black walnut trees with green (unripe) husks.
Step 2: Collect green husks from the nuts - avoid dried or brown husks.
Step 3: Crush the green husks thoroughly to release the toxic compounds.
Step 4: Throw the crushed husks into a small area of quiet water.
Step 5: Wait for fish to become unable to breathe and rise to the surface.
Step 6: Collect all affected fish - they remain safe to eat.
warnings: Only use green (fresh) husks - dried husks are less effective.
This method makes fish unable to breathe but doesn't affect their edibility.
Works best in quiet, confined water areas.
